facts.text: ICP's 'H.O.C.' (Homies Of Clowns) style kicks off with garbled charisma bars â€“ a nod to their underground rap roots since 1989! ğŸª
'Ninja poof' refs ICP's ninja personas from early albums like Carnival of Carnage â€“ they've sold 7M+ albums worldwide. ğŸ¥·
Shaggy 2 Dope & Violent J, Detroit natives, started as Juggalo icons with Psychopathic Records in '91. ğŸ¤¡ğŸ’€
Kamikaze pit dives mirror ICP's insane live shows â€“ Gathering of the Juggalos fest draws 10K+ fans yearly! ğŸ•³ï¸
This 2012 track dropped in ICP's post-'Miracles' era, after their viral 2010 YouTube hit with 100M+ views. ğŸ“ˆ
Scientology diss echoes ICP's feud culture â€“ they once battled Eminem on 'Marshall Mathers LP' diss tracks. âš”ï¸
Wild family incest boasts are classic ICP shock rap â€“ banned from many venues for explicit Juggalo anthems. ğŸ˜ˆ
Elephant-chipmunk tongue kiss? Pure ICP absurdity, like their Faygo-spraying concerts since '97. ğŸ˜ğŸ¿ï¸
Lil Wayne's '6 Foot 7 Foot' inspired this parody â€“ ICP flipped it into Juggalo rage against haters. ğŸª„
'Mass mur-barbecue' gorefest style from ICP's horrorcore roots â€“ debuted on 'The Wraith' album saga. ğŸ”¥
ICP reps Southwest Detroit â€“ hailing from Delray, once called 'the asshole of Detroit' for its grit. ğŸ™ï¸
Eminem shout? Ironic, as ICP's 'Slim Shady' diss track sparked a decades-long rap beef. ğŸ¥Š
'Whitney Payton'? Likely Whitney Houston mix-up â€“ ICP loves celeb name-drops in chaos lyrics. â­
Psychopathic Records, ICP's label, hosts Juggalo gatherings â€“ FBI once called fans a 'gang' in 2011. ğŸ´â€â˜ ï¸
Paper chasing boasts hide ICP's rags-to-riches: from welfare to $40M net worth empire. ğŸ’°
Michael Jackson nod â€“ ICP covered 'Threatening Little Bastard' on their rare collabs album. ğŸ‘‘
Hatchetman flags & scrubs are Juggalo merch staples â€“ 'scrubs' means face paint for shows. âš“
